content:
On Jan 2, 2024, the X account Historic Vids posted a video purporting to show UFC fighter Conor McGregor being "given a warning for putting his arm over Vladimir Putin" during a photo op:
Conor McGregor was given a warning for putting his arm over Vladimir Putin pic.twitter.com/pUg9HYDkIJ
— Historic Vids (@historyinmemes) January 3, 2024

Some users of Community Notes, a fact-checking initiative on X, suggested the video is misleading or manipulated because the order of events has been reversed — something that occurred with another video of Putin.
However, while the McGregor video is edited slightly to make it shorter, the events depicted occur in the order in which they should, and the cuts that were made do not strip it of any meaningful context, as shown by the full, unedited version:

While the interpretation that McGregor was "warned" is somewhat subjective, McGregor does remove his arm from Putin's shoulder after a member of Putin's entourage signals to him, and newspaper reports suggest that, indeed, he was asked to remove his arm.

The meeting occurred at the 2018 World Cup at Putin's invitation, as reported by the BBC:
Conor McGregor has caused controversy by calling Russian president Vladimir Putin "one of the greatest leaders of our time".
The MMA fighter posted a photo to Instagram of himself with Mr Putin at the World Cup final in Moscow.
Some fans weren't happy with the 30-year-old's choice to accept the Russian leader's invitation to the match in Moscow.
Because the video authentically portrays this meeting and documents an apparent request for McGregor to remove his arm, this claim is True.

original_rationales.main_rationale: Because the video authentically portrays this meeting and documents an apparent request for McGregor to remove his arm, this claim is True.
original_rationales.additional_rationale1: While the interpretation that McGregor was "warned" is somewhat subjective, McGregor does remove his arm from Putin's shoulder after a member of Putin's entourage signals to him, and newspaper reports suggest that, indeed, he was asked to remove his arm.
original_rationales.additional_rationale2: Some fans weren't happy with the 30-year-old's choice to accept the Russian leader's invitation to the match in Moscow.

summary_rationales.synthesized_rationale: The claim has been rated as 'True' because the video posted by Historic Vids accurately depicts UFC fighter Conor McGregor putting his arm around Russian President Vladimir Putin before removing it following a signal from an individual in Putin's entourage. The video, despite being slightly edited for brevity, authentically captures the sequence of events without manipulating their order, as supported by newspaper reports and accounts of the meeting at the 2018 World Cup.

detailed_reasons.reason1: The video, although shortened for brevity, presents the events in the correct chronological order, demonstrating McGregor placing his arm around Putin and subsequently retracting it after being gestured by a member of Putin's entourage. This sequence aligns with accounts provided by newspaper reports and the fact-checking initiative.
detailed_reasons.reason2: Reports from newspaper sources corroborate the authenticity of the depicted interaction between McGregor and Putin at the 2018 World Cup, where McGregor referred to Putin as a significant political figure. This contextual background supports the legitimacy of the encounter as shown in the video.
detailed_reasons.reason3: The fact that the video accurately captures the essence of McGregor's action towards Putin, as well as the response from Putin's entourage, adds to the credibility of the claim's truthfulness. Hence, the combination of video evidence and external verifications substantiates the 'True' rating assigned to the claim.
